page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There are 2{Roman camps}on a site in {Metchley Park,Selly Oak.}The larger fort,covering 12 acres,is thought to date back to A.D.40-50.The inner fort, which covers 6 acres,dates back to A.D.90. Excavation of the forts began in 1954 {Pottery, buckles,}and some{weapons used by soldiers during Roman occupation were unearthed.A metal gate 2.3 inches thick was also found.30ft to the west of the fort there is evidence of a road leading to it. The fort probably protected a small area of{Harborne},and was occupied for about 100 years.All that remains today are a few small wooden posts joined together with planks on a grass verge. Along the base of the verge is a shallow ditch.
